Posts.Content: On 2/26/2007 Help me Help Mom wrote: My mom just started chemo treatments for breast cancer. When the docters told her she would lose her hair...she cried. And now...two weeks after first treatment, she has started to lose her hair and is tearyeyed off and on. I want to make her feel better. I offered to shave my head, but she said not to. I don't know what I can do or say to make her feel better. When she crys I cry. Does any one have any ideas for me.                                        Kim  I am in the process of my hair growning back due to chemo for breast cancer.   My husband supported me with his reminders that it is only temporary.  When I would get down, he would remind me again.  I have worn a wig since June 18, 2006 and would not have been able to accept baldness without it.  I had people tell me how nice my hair looked & ask where I got it cut (these are people who didn't know I had lost my hair).  If she doesn't have a wig, I certainly would recommend her to be fit for one - she will feel much better about herself, I'm sure.  It's alright to have tears - I did a number of times but snapped out of it.  Just keep reminding her that it is only temporary & it will soon be behind her.  Good luck to both of you & God bless you for wanting to be supportive for your mom.  Bonnie
